intro: Brassica tigridis, commonly known as the tiger mustard, is an annual flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, characterized by its cross-shaped flowers and capsule fruits. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–100 cm, with hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves. Its bright yellow flowers bloom in early summer, attracting various pollinators. Brassica tigridis is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of habitats.
